page.title: 09CUSTOMS AT CHURCH AND SCHOOL
page.content: The old school was next to the church. Now it has been converted into a house. Before 1963 when it became a maintained school it had been a church school. The children had to go to a service on Friday and were also expected to attend the service on Sundays. On Monday the vicar would come in and test the children on his sermon. They had lessons on religion every day for half an hour. On Ascencion Day there was a special service for the school, after which they would go for a walk across the fields and around the school. The children collected halfpennies for a new coloured statue of Mary which stands in front of the altar, and the old wooden one now stands at the back of the church. Children in the choir wore blue cassocks and were strictly supervised by the schoolmistress.
